question: Question_01_(b)
statement: Define the matrix norm for a matrix \emph{A}.
sols:
The matrix norm of a matrix \emph{A} compares
$\left| \left| A \vec{x} \right| \right|$ to
$\left| \left| \vec{x} \right| \right|$ where $\vec{x}$ is some vector.
This comparison between the two terms depends on what $\vec{x}$ is, and
we want $\vec{x}$ that makes $\left| \left| A \vec{x} \right| \right|$
the biggest.

The matrix norm of \emph{A}:

\[\left| \left| A \vec{x} \right| \right| = \underset{\vec{x};\vec{x} \neq 0}{max} \frac{\left| \left| A \vec{x} \right| \right|}{\| \vec{x} \| }\]
